Maybe add a few sentences about why this is needed to save reviewers' time to look through stacked changes
I think GetSubTreePaths callback only accepts vector. Also keeping this as vector to align with other calls e.g. getCollectionMembers

Could you depend on this patch?
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/58580
I prefer to not chain it with other patches. If that patch gets merged, I update my patch to reflect that change
Since your change is merged, I updated the CL to use the getSubTreePaths API

Please review: https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/58924
This patch will be merged this week 😊
This functions to me is to get a dbus response sorted and then get that into the JSON response, where the name of the function to me is just to sort something. Consider a better name?
Please add unit test for new code like this that's unit testable.
Apologies for the confusion. This is a callback function to be passed to dbus::utility::getSubTreePaths() and it does set a response. Updated the API name
prefer const string reference over pointer.

Overall I agree with this statement, but this API, and the major lifting needs to be done in the mapper to avoid sending large DBus payloads, then throwing most of it away.  As a general rule, we should not be pulling more data than we need, then filtering or sorting it to turn it into what we need.  Just add the appropriate mapper APIs to get the data we need directly.

While there are places where we do this in inefficient ways, they're not generic, so there is still some level of fixups that we could do, but this generic one implies that it's the expected way to do this, and by the openbmc design, this kind of thing needs done in the mapper.

Makes total sense. I think Willy has already proposed a CL to add such mapper APIs, which fits exactly into our requirement.

https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/phosphor-objmgr/+/57822

Since it is still under review, I guess my change should wait until it merges.

Keeping this comment open, so I can update the current CL once those mapper are available.

I am seeing bmcweb crash when converting the boost::urls::url_view to boost::urls::url. The conversion is needed to pass it to crow::utility::appendUrlPieces method below in line 146. I also tried extracting the string using collectionPath.buffer() and std::string(collectionPath.buffer()) both and then converting to boost::urls::url , but it still crashes.
This kind of conversion needs done in the mapper.  If we need new mapper APIs, so be it, but we shouldn't be filtering at this level.
Ack.. Replied on previous comment, that a change to add the mappers is under review and the current one will probably need to wait until the mapper change is merged
I don't think std::move does anything here.
Variables in the capture list by default are converted to const. If 'interfaces' becomes const, it cannot be passed down as std::span to 'getSubTreePaths'. mutable avoids the const conversion.
Why does interfaces need to be non const?
If a particular system does not have the associations setup, then the collection response would result in a Get error. To avoid that, simply return in case of any error in getProperty call

Does this not require the second parameter to be the `depth`?

```
getSubTreePaths("/xyz/openbmc_project/inventory", /**depth=*/0, interfaces...)
```

https://github.com/openbmc/bmcweb/blob/master/include/dbus_utility.hpp#L161
yes.. My HEAD of local bmcweb repo was old. I have updated it now.

Looks like wltu got this done:
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/q/topic:associated-subtree-mapper-wltu
nit: can combine since path is not used elsewhere.
